definition: each other/one another
that/those/(one) another
this/these
to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
no better (or worse) than each other/both in the same boat
no better (or worse) than each other/both in the same boat

sentences.english: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.
sentences.chinese: 都恒心遵守使徒的教训，彼此交接，擘饼，祈祷。

sentences.english: This way, you can create rows different from each other.
sentences.chinese: 这样，您可以创建彼此之间不同的行。

sentences.english: Her mom replied, “Because they love each other.” MMT
sentences.chinese: 她的妈妈回答道，“因为他们彼此相爱。”

sentences.english: They knock each other off balance just a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 她说，“他们只是一点点敲击彼此的不平衡之处。”

sentences.english: We belonged to each other. Forever.
sentences.chinese: 我们属于彼此，永远属于。

sentences.english: However, this does not prevent us from the start of their feelings of confidence.
sentences.chinese: 可是，这并不妨碍我们对彼此感情地久天长的信心。

sentences.english: And our Eyes tell each other, what neither dares Name.
sentences.chinese: 我们的眼睛告诉彼此那都不敢说的爱。

sentences.english: Exchanging little gifts they ve made for each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们彼此交换着亲手做的小礼物。

sentences.english: For Israel and the Philistines had put the battle in array, army against army.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人和非利士人都摆列队伍，彼此相对。

sentences.english: They can never get along with each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们永远无法彼此和睦相处。

sentences.english: They briefly came into contact at a very low speed while submerged.
sentences.chinese: 它们主要是在潜入水中时低速接触彼此。

sentences.english: E. If the enclosing sides adjoin each other, the area should be properly vented.
sentences.chinese: 如果封闭的侧面彼此邻接，该区域要有适当的通风。

sentences.english: People survive because they are really good cooperators.
sentences.chinese: 人们进化是因为他们彼此间是最好的合作伙伴。

sentences.english: Molecules repel each other when they collide .
sentences.chinese: 当分子相碰撞时彼此互斥。

sentences.english: Premier's European tour to build trust.
sentences.chinese: 温总理欧洲之行是为了建立彼此信任。

sentences.english: where apparently future attorneys don't like talking to each other very much.
sentences.chinese: 而显然，未来的律师们是不太喜欢彼此交谈的。
